flawed_nl_solution:
Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=120>>120 cards.
Janet has 120/2 = <<120/2=60>>60 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.
Brenda has 60 - 9 = <<60-9=51>>51 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.
Therefore, they all have 120 + 60 + 51 = <<120+60+51=231>>231 cards.
#### 231

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 110, not 120. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
